channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl for High Performance; Senior Developer, London
item.description: Household name in the UK looking for an excellent problem solver comfortable with getting stuck into their very successful platform: the APIs that drive their website, intensive/distributed data processing, valuation algorithms and the ops work that binds it all together

item.title: Largest Perl team in London with beautiful Docklands offices
item.description: Large, dynamic Perl team in Canary Wharf looking for mid-level and senior developers. Run by a Perl-loving CTO in beautiful offices with a great view over Canary Wharf

item.title: Senior multilingual developer needed for a fast growing team in London
item.description: This is a chance to keep your skills sharp and shiny while working with a small fun team. A chance to work with a platform that is growing fast and gives you the chance to stay with the same team without always doing the same thing.

item.title: Perl Event Roppongi.pm #1 at 2018/9/14
item.description: Yuki Kimoto kind shares some photos from the event.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: How Building a 'Women Who Code' Chapter Made Me a Better Engineer
item.description: An inspiraional story of a women making her presence known.

item.title: Perl6::Math::Matrix (Part 3: when to use MMD)
item.description: In this third instalment of the series, the author talks about how to use MMD (multi method dispatch) the right way.

item.title: How to make CRUD operations in JSON (Part 2)
item.description: I never knew you could do this so easily.

item.title: We Don't Need No Stinking map() or filter()
item.description: It opens up many questions, you really don't want to miss out.

item.title: ps aux output in cronjobs
item.description: A very handy tip for SysAdmin who deals with cronjobs on a daily basis.

item.title: Thoughts on interpreted vs compiled languages?
item.description: Thought provoking discussion and must read for everyone.

item.title: The way to create Class with only Perl core language.
item.description: Back to basics, how to create Class in perl by Yuki Kimoto.

item.title: Installing set of modules
item.description: In order to quickly install a set of Perl modules for a given task, it is nice to have some kind of meta-package serving no other purpose than pulling in a set of other more specific packages.

item.title: Sydney Perl Tomorrow! (2018-09-25)
item.description: Please join for September meeting of Sydney Perl Mongers.

item.title: Make your business stick with StickerYou.comâ€™s world-leading sticker maker
item.description: StickerYou.com is your one-stop shop to make your business stick. You can create custom stickers, labels, decals, magnets, and more in any size, shape, and order quantity. If youâ€™re printing your own custom stickers for your staff or to hand out at events, we have you covered. Start designing today with StickerYouâ€™s world-leading sticker maker. Use code PERL10 at checkout for a 10% discount.

item.title: #374 - London Perl Workshop 2018
item.description:
As you all know the London Perl Workshop is finally happening on 24th November 2018. If you are going to be in London on the day then I recommend you should visit us. Like every year, this year also we are planning to have collection of great talks and workshops. This year, in particular, we encourage newcomers to come forward and give a short talk (20 min), if not then at least lightning talk (5 min). It doesn't have to about Perl. You could chose any topic you like. Based on my personal exeperience, it will be a life changing experience. If you need any assistane get in touch and we would be more than happy to help you. For senior speakers, please start submiting talk proposals. Here is the link to submit talk.

Happy reading newsletter !!!
